sub_title: Information Manager at Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies - IHS
summary: Nigel Browne as Information Manager is responsible for the upkeep of the IHS library collection and content provision required to support course development and implementation. He also maintains contacts with external libraries and information networks, manages the subscriptions of (on-line) journals, and arranges access to the ever-increasing number of publications that become available digitally. He advises course coordinators on the availability of relevant publications, sources and references that may be of interest to their courses and thematic interests, manages the acquisition of new publications, and assists in assembling materials for thematic readers. Since January 2014 he has also been involved in helping to develop a Resource Hub on the internet for the EU Transformative Social Innovation Theory (TRANSIT) project, a project for which IHS is responsible for Communication and Dissemination. The Transit project ended in December 2017 and it is archived at http://www.transitsocialinnovation.eu/ Since then I have developed a number of further knowledge products on the IHS website including the SDG 11 Resource Hub (see: https://www.ihs.nl/en/resources/library/sdg-11-knowledge-hub) and four sections of the COVID-19 Resource Hub (see: https://www.ihs.nl/en/resources/covid-19-resource-hub). The section on Journal Articles is the section that receives the most regular updates listing the latest articles reflecting the social, economic and environmental impacts of the COVID-19 epidemic on cities and towns in low-income countries in particular (see: https://www.ihs.nl/en/journal-articles-covid-19)

treasury_media.title: Regarding Smart Cities in China, the North and Emerging Economies—One Size Does Not Fit All
treasury_media.description: This article explores the significance of the “Smart city” concept by reviewing its key components, namely: Internet of Things (IoT), big (urban) data, and urban informatics/analytics, which are discussed against the background of two ongoing trends...

company.name: Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies - IHS

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description:
- Running, maintaining and developing an up-to-date library in support of IHS’ UMD Masters programme
- Managing the library; maintaining the library databases (including digital content)
- Administration of the library budget; 
- (Electronic) journal administration; 
- Internet searching upon request for course development
- Generally assisting academic staff and students in finding and accessing the information they need. 
See: http://www.ihs.nl/
profile_positions.title: Information Manager

profile_positions.description: Planning and maintaining contacts with (external) lecturers and students on all matters relating to the smooth running of the course; maintaining a digital learning environment; coaching and supporting students during their studies; consulting with lecturers on the curriculum and course programme and marketing the course.
profile_positions.title: Co-ordinator of Post Academic Study in Information and Document Management

company.name: IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre

profile_positions.company: IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre
profile_positions.description: Documentalist/Information Specialist in the Library/Documentation Centre Main duties included: adding records to an internal bibliographic database; contributing towards the realization of the virtual “water” library; dealing with internal and external information queries; assisting (inter)national library visitors, training course and briefing programme participants, and colleagues; and contributing to innovative information products and services
profile_positions.title: Information Manager
